<section begin="Description" />The '''Aranara Language''' ''(unofficial name)'' is the language spoken by the Aranara of [[Sumeru]]. The [[Aranara]] often include words from this language while speaking. It also appears that there may be a script for this language written in multiple [[Aranara]] inscriptions, such as the text found on the [[Silapna]]'s leaf, or the text written on multiple walls.

The language's lexicon appears to be based on Sanskrit. For example, the Aranara term for human or person, "Nara," likely comes from {{Lang|mini=1|sa=नर|sa_rm=nara|sa_tl=human, person.}} Similarly, the Aranara word for [[Spinocrocodile]], "Apshvaana," is Sanskrit for "water dog" and derives from {{Lang|mini=1|sa=अप्|sa_rm=ap|sa_tl=water}} and {{Lang|mini=1|sa=श्वान|sa_rm=śvāna|sa_tl=dog.}}<section end="Description" />

==Trivia==
* Aranara typically prefix human names with "Nara" (e.g., Nara Varuna), but if the human name sounds too similar, they may simply combine them (e.g., "Nara [[Rana]]" becomes "Narana").
** [[Arana]] considers "Narana" to have the same name as her.<ref>{{Ref/Quest|For All Children Who Long for Life}}</ref>
